definition: to topple (i.e. knock over)/to capsize/fig. to overturn (a regime, by plotting or subversion)/to undermine/to subvert
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
incitement to subvert state power (criminal charge used to gag free speech)
pinyin: shan1 dong4 dian1 fu4 guo2 jia1 zheng4 quan2

definition: crime of conspiring to overthrow the state
pinyin: shan1 dong4 dian1 fu4 guo2 jia1 zui4

definition: the crime of conspiracy to overthrow the government
pinyin: yin1 mou2 dian1 fu4 zheng4 fu3 zui4

definition: crime of incitement to overthrow the state/abbr. for 煽動顛覆國家政權|煽动颠覆国家政权[shan1 dong4 dian1 fu4 guo2 jia1 zheng4 quan2]
crime of incitement to overthrow the state/abbr. for 煽動顛覆國家政權|煽动颠覆国家政权[shan1 dong4 dian1 fu4 guo2 jia1 zheng4 quan2]
crime of incitement to overthrow the state/abbr. for 煽動顛覆國家政權|煽动颠覆国家政权[shan1 dong4 dian1 fu4 guo2 jia1 zheng4 quan2]

sentences.english: So is an change for the better, like birth and death which convulse the body.
sentences.chinese: 向更好的轉變也是如此，和顛覆身體的生死一樣。

sentences.english: Slipper dream compared to the people, Kate has overturned that idea.
sentences.chinese: 相比人們的水晶鞋夢，凱特卻顛覆了這種觀念。

sentences.english: Do not do anything that might upset social stability.
sentences.chinese: 不要做可能顛覆社會的安定任何事。

sentences.english: It is audacious, disruptive and preposterous on the face of it.
sentences.chinese: 表面看來，其膽大妄爲，且顛覆常理，又荒誕可笑。

sentences.english: But economic reform and mass urbanization in the last 30 years have upended these norms.
sentences.chinese: 但過去30年的經濟改革和大規模城市化顛覆了這些。

sentences.english: This matter overturned all reasons that I learned on Sunday in the school.
sentences.chinese: 這件事把我從週日學校學到的所有道理都顛覆了。

sentences.english: The foreign team upset the local team.
sentences.chinese: 這個外來隊竟把地方隊給顛覆了。

sentences.english: The digital world has blown the doors off traditional job-search methods.
sentences.chinese: 數字世界顛覆了傳統的求職方法。

sentences.english: This ambivalence subverts and deconstructs logos centre doctrine.
sentences.chinese: 這種雙重性認識是對邏各斯中心主義的顛覆和解構。

sentences.english: It was definitely a paradigm shift, because it got this stress thing debunked.
sentences.chinese: 這絕對是一個模式轉移，因爲它顛覆了壓力學說。

sentences.english: This is a subversion of the traditional image of the comedy film Once Upon a Time.
sentences.chinese: 這是一部顛覆黃飛鴻傳統形象的喜劇電影。

sentences.english: The quest for ever-more and ever-better prosperity subverts itself.
sentences.chinese: 追求更多更好的繁榮，會顛覆繁榮本身。

sentences.english: Some might see the overturning of Citizens United.
sentences.chinese: 有些人或許會顛覆聯邦公民的判例。

sentences.english: Wilde also challenges and subverts innumerable binary oppositions throughout his life.
sentences.chinese: 王爾德一生也顛覆了難以數計的二元對立。

sentences.english: The guide rail of working table has large span and strong anti-overturn capacity.
sentences.chinese: 工作臺導軌跨距大，抗顛覆能力強。

sentences.english: This story is very interesting. It completely subverts the traditional story.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事還滿有趣的，這完全顛覆了傳統的同會故事。

definition: to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
